briefTitle: Peginterferon α-2b as a Maintenance Therapy in Participants With Multiple Myeloma Who Responded to Induction Therapy (P01972-AM7)
officialTitle: Phase III Randomized, Prospective Multi-center Trial of PEG-Interferon α-2b as a Maintenance Therapy, Compared to Observation, in Patients With Multiple Myeloma Who Responded to Induction Therapy (Protocol No P01972)
summary: This study aims to assess the efficacy of peginterferon α-2b, compared to a control arm not receiving any maintenance treatment, in adult subjects with multiple myeloma who have responded to a prior induction therapy. Peginterferon α-2b will be given once weekly as an injection until disease progression or relapse, or for up to a maximum of 5 years (whichever occurs first).

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Days With Progression Free Survival (PFS)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline and up to 5 years (or to the date of the first documented tumor progression or relapse)
